administer.translation[0].definitions[0]: to manage the work or money of a company or organization
The money will be administered by local charities.
Our office administers the affairs of the Society.
Administer is often passive in this meaning
administer.translation[0].definitions[1]: to provide or organize something officially as part of your job
administer an oath (=be the official person who listens to it)
It is not the job of the police to administer justice; that falls to the courts.
Pillai had responsibility for administering to the needs of half a million people.
The test was administered to all 11-year-olds.
administer.translation[0].definitions[2]: to give someone a medicine or medical treatment
This unit teaches students how to administer first aid.
Painkillers were administered to the boy.
administer.translation[1].definitions[0]: to manage, organize, and control something and make sure it is dealt with correctly
A new national fund will be administered by the insurance industry.
the bureaucrats who administer welfare programs
administer.translation[1].definitions[1]: They were responsible for maintaining order and administering justice within their community.
